choices.text:
what are the catagories of figures of speech?
There are several categories of figures of speech, including:
1. Similes (e.g. "It's like a phoenix rises from the ashes").
2. Metaphors (e.g. "The world is my oyster").
3. Idioms (e.g. "Bite off more than you can chew").
4. Hyperbole (e.g. "I'm a giant, I'm a giant!).
5. Personification (e.g. "The world is my playground").
6. Alliteration (e.g. "The rain in Spain stays the same... no matter what the weather may be like.").
7. Onomatopoietic (e.g. "The name of the game is to never give up.")
8. Oxymoron (e.g. "I'm a giant, I'm a giant!").
9. Palindromic (e.g. "The world is my playground.")
10. Syllabic (e.g. "The name of the game is to never give up.")
